Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2011 03:51PM tracie23 wrote: You are not foolish at all !!!!! before I was diagnosed with cancer I was going to have a double mastectomy because I am BRCA2 positive , than my husband got laid off and we lost our ins. One year later I had a lump in one breast and here I am. I chose to have a double mastectomey because I never ever want to do this again. Chemo is the worst part and if I can eliminate having chemo again I will. I am having a hysterectomy this spring as well. The choice for me was easy. I am sorry you even have to make these decisions it sucks so much!!!! Best wishes with what ever you choose.

I still have some peach fuzz on my face but it gets less and less everyday... when I first started getting my hair back I could have shaved my legs 3 times a day that to has slowed down. Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2011 09:36PM tracie23 wrote: Hi Cari-Anne  I had neutropenia one time ended up in the hospital with an infection and they put me right on to the Nuelasta shot after each chemo. I still get infections. It can be very serious. As for being in the house for a week..... I have had such bad reactions to chemo I have been in the house with only a few trips out for the past 3 weeks. If you feel good I am sure there is something you can do inside unless you are already really organized? Good luck

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2011 05:11PM tracie23 wrote: Hi Ladies, My mother had breast cancer twice and it came from her fathers side. We did the gene tree all the genetic testing and there was nothing on her mothers side. I would also get another opinion. On one of the threads a doctor told a 30yr old women not to worry most women her age don't get cancer..... If I knew where he was I would go kick his a$$. Mommyrnx2: hang in there. I had a double mastectomy with no recon. I didn't know if I would need rads or not. I hope to have new boobs in the next 6 to 8 months. I did ok with the surgery I think I was more upset over losing my hair. I will keep you in my prayers.
